sources.name: Personal Status Law (Royal Decree No. M/73 of 2022)
Law of Procedure Before Sharia Courts

steps.title: Filing of Family Dispute Request
steps.description: A family dispute relating to marriage, divorce, maintenance, custody, or guardianship is filed electronically through the Najiz platform.

steps.title: Reconciliation and Mediation
steps.description: The Reconciliation Center conducts mediation sessions to attempt amicable resolution in accordance with Saudi family procedure.

conditional_branches.effect: Dispute resolved and settlement documented in accordance with Sharia

typical_outcomes: Partial settlement with remaining issues litigated
No settlement and referral to court
dependencies: Presence of children or custody issues
Compatibility of settlement with Sharia principles

failure_risks: Disputes over Sharia compliance of settlement terms

steps.title: Filing Before Personal Status Court
steps.description: If reconciliation fails, the dispute is formally filed before the Personal Status Court for adjudication.

steps.title: Hearings and Evidence Review
steps.description: Court conducts hearings, reviews evidence, and hears submissions in accordance with Sharia and statutory law.

steps.title: Judgment
steps.description: Court issues judgment resolving the family dispute, including orders on divorce, custody, or maintenance.

steps.title: Appeal
steps.description: Judgment may be appealed before higher courts as permitted under Saudi law.

escalation_paths.condition: Appeal on points of law or Sharia compliance
